summary: The document is a confidential FBI report from February 13, 1959, detailing information from the Dutch Internal Security Service about Mollie Block and her husband Morris Block. It covers their travels, including Mollie's journey from Amsterdam to Moscow via Warsaw in November 1958 on a KLM flight, and Morris's arrival in Amsterdam from Montreal in August 1958. Morris intended to move his family to Moscow, expressing dissatisfaction with living in a country where freedom was not fully realized. The report also notes items in their possession, such as a birth certificate, visiting cards, and a pin from the 1957 World Festival of Youth and Students in Moscow.
key_findings: Mollie Block traveled from Amsterdam to Moscow via Warsaw in November 1958.
Morris Block arrived in Amsterdam from Montreal in August 1958 with intentions to settle in Moscow.
Morris Block was a delegate at the World Youth Festival in Moscow in 1957.
The Blocks had items linking them to the Soviet Union, including a festival pin and visiting cards.
Morris Block expressed a desire to relocate to the Soviet Union due to issues with freedom in the United States.
